kassenSystem.model

Class CategoryList

  • java.lang.Object
    • kassenSystem.model.CategoryList

  • public class CategoryList
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the CategoryDatabase and CategoryList.

      • CategoryList

        public CategoryList()
        CategoryList constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • addCategory

        public void addCategory(java.lang.String category)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a category to the categoryList. Checks if the category name is between 3 and 32 Symbols and does not contain any Number, or punctuation symbol (/,.,_,etc.). Throws Exception if the category does not meet the requirements.
        Parameters:
        category - the new category that is being added to the CategoryList
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the category is shorter then 3 or longer then 32 symbols, or contains a number, or punctuation symbol

      • removeCategory

        public void removeCategory(java.lang.String category)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes the specified category from the list. Throws Exception if the category that is being removed is still used by any product in the productList.
        Parameters:
        category - the category to be removed from CategoryList
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the category that is being removed is still used by any product in the productList

      • changeCategory

        public void changeCategory(java.lang.String category,
                           java.lang.String newCategory)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes a category name to a new category name. Also changes all appearances in products in ProductList. Throws Exception if the category name does not meet the requirements set by the addCategory function.
        Parameters:
        category - the category to be changed
        newCategory - the new category name
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the category name does not meet the requirements set by the addCategory function

      • getCategoryList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCategoryList()
        Returns the category list.
        Returns:
        the CategoryList

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empties the CategoryList of all entries.

      • searchCategory

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchCategory(java.lang.String search)
        Searches for a category in the category list. The entered String can be a substring of the results or a specific name.
        Parameters:
        search - the (sub)string to search for
        Returns:
        an array of all categories that contained the (sub)string

      • categoryInList

        public boolean categoryInList(java.lang.String category)
        Searches if a specific category is in the categoryList.
        Parameters:
        category - the category you search for
        Returns:
        true if the category is in the list, false otherwise

      • saveToCategoryDatabase

        public void saveToCategoryDatabase()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Saves all categories to the Database. The save function will be executed only once when the application is closed, because the way the category list is implemented represents an inMemory database. Throws IOException if the the file the writer accesses is non existent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the the file the writer accesses is non existent

      • loadFromCategoryDatabase

        public void loadFromCategoryDatabase()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads all Categories from the CategoryDatabase. The load function will be executed only once when the application is started, because the way the category list is implemented represents an inMemory database. Throws IO Exception if there is no file or a wrong path declared to read from.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the the file the reader accesses is non existent
